Open datastore.Summary: connects the application to the remote datastore identified by the *connectionInfo* parameter

Print form.Summary: The **Print form** command simply prints *form* with the current values of fields and variables of *aTable*.

ID of process for which to retrieve the process number

SELECT LOG FILE.Summary: The **SELECT LOG FILE** command creates, or closes the log file according to the value you pass in parameter

Session info.Summary: returns an object describing the session whose ID you pass in the *sessionID* parameter.

Session storage.Summary: The **Session storage** command returns the storage object of the session whose unique identifier you passed in the *id* parameter.

Session.Summary: returns the `Session` object corresponding to the current user session

SET ALLOWED METHODS.Summary: The **SET ALLOWED METHODS** command designates the project methods that can be entered via the application.

**SET WINDOW DOCUMENT ICON** ( *winRef* ; *image* )

SET WINDOW DOCUMENT ICON.Summary: allows you to define an icon for windows in multi-window applications using either an *image* and/or *file* with the window reference *winRef*

Params: Parameter(s) to pass to the parent constructor
Super.Summary: allows calls to the `superclass`, i.e. the parent class

This.Summary: returns a reference to the currently processed object.

USE ENTITY SELECTION.Summary: updates the current selection of the table matching the dataclass of the *entitySelection* parameter, according to the content of the entity selection

Object name (if * is specified) or Variable (if * is omitted).

WA Get context.Summary: retrieves the context object defined for `$4d` in the Web area designated by the * and *object* parameters using `WA SET CONTEXT`.

Object name (if * is specified) or Variable (if * is omitted).
Object containing the functions that can be called with `$4d`.
WA SET CONTEXT.Summary: defines a context object *contextObj* for `$4d` in the Web area designated by the * and *object* parameters. When this command is used, `$4d` can only access contents declared within the provided *contextObj*. When no context object is set, `$4d` has access to all 4D methods and can not access user classes.

Params: Collection of the available Web Server objects
WEB Server list.Summary: returns a collection of all Web server objects available in the 4D application

Params: Web server to get (default if omitted = `Web server database`)
WEB Server.Summary: returns the default Web server object, or the Web server object defined through the *option* parameter

ZIP Create archive.Syntax:

Params: File or Folder object to compress
File or Folder object to compress
File or Folder object to compress

ZIP Read archive.Summary: retrieves the contents of *zipFile* and returns it as a `4D.ZipArchive` object

ABORT PROCESS BY ID.Summary: The **ABORT PROCESS BY ID** command stops a specific process on the 4D Server.

ABORT.Summary: The **ABORT** command is used from within an error-handling project method installed using the command ON ERR CALL.

Params: Number for which to return the absolute value
Abs.Summary: Abs returns the absolute (unsigned, positive) value of *number*.

ACCEPT.Summary: **ACCEPT** performs the same action as if a user had pressed the Enter key. After the form is accepted, the OK system variable is set to 1.

Params: Numeric field or variable on which to accumulate
ACCUMULATE.Summary: **ACCUMULATE** specifies the fields or variables to be accumulated during a form report performed using PRINT SELECTION.

Params: Standard action name or pattern including parameter if required
Defines the target of the action to get information: main form or current form
Object containing action status as boolean properties: isEnabled, isVisible, isChecked, isMixed, isUnknownState
Action info.Summary: The **Action info** command returns several information, including availability and status, about the defined *action* in the *target*, according to the current application context.

Params: Returns TRUE if the execution cycle is an activation
Activated.Summary: The **Activated** command (obsolete) returns **True** in a form method when the window containing the form becomes the frontmost window of the frontmost process.

Params: Returns False if the current transaction is suspended
Active transaction.Summary: The **Active transaction** command returns **True** if the current process is in transaction, and this transaction is not suspended.

Params:
Complete description of operations (object array) or
Operation UUIDs (text array)
Details of context and sub-operations (if any)
ACTIVITY SNAPSHOT.Summary: The **ACTIVITY SNAPSHOT** command returns a single or several arrays describing operations in progress on the 4D data.

Params: Table to use for data entry, or Default table, if omitted
ADD RECORD.Summary: *This command was implemented in 4D's early releases and is still useful for prototyping or basic developments.

Params: Date to which to add days, months, and years
Number of years to add to the date
Number of months to add to the date
Number of days to add to the date
Add to date.Summary: The **Add to date** command adds *years*, *months,* and *days* to the date you pass in *aDate*, then returns the result.

Params: Current record's table, or Default table, if omitted
Name of the set to which to add the current record
ADD TO SET.Summary: ADD TO SET adds the current record of *aTable* to *set*.

Params: Table whose "blobs" data priority value has to be adjusted
Cache priority value for BLOBs in the table
ADJUST BLOBS CACHE PRIORITY.Summary: This command is reserved for specific needs.

Cache priority value for the field index(es)
ADJUST INDEX CACHE PRIORITY.Summary: This command is reserved for specific needs.

Params: Table whose scalar data priority value has to be adjusted
Cache priority value for the table
ADJUST TABLE CACHE PRIORITY.Summary: This command is reserved for specific needs.

After.Summary: **After** returns True for the After execution cycle.

ALERT.Summary: The **ALERT** command displays an alert dialog box composed of a note icon, a message, and an OK button.

Params: Table for which to select all records, or Default table, if omitted
ALL RECORDS.Summary: ALL RECORDS selects all the records of *aTable* for the current process.

Params: Type of data to be added
Data to append to the pasteboard
APPEND DATA TO PASTEBOARD.Summary: The APPEND DATA TO PASTEBOARD command appends to the pasteboard the data contained in the BLOB *data* under the data type specified in *dataType*.

Params: Document name or Full document pathname or Empty string for standard file dialog box
List of types of documents to be screened, or "*" to not screen the documents
Append document.Summary: The **Append document** command does the same as thing as Open document: it opens a document on disk.

Params: Text for the new menu items
Reference of submenu associated with item
If passed: consider metacharacters as standard characters
APPEND MENU ITEM.Summary: The **APPEND MENU ITEM** command appends new menu items to the menu whose number or reference is passed in *menu*.

Params: Array to which an element will be appended
APPEND TO ARRAY.Summary: The APPEND TO ARRAY command adds a new element at the end of *array* and assigns *value* to the element.

Unique reference number for the new list item
Optional sublist to attach to the new list item
Indicates if the optional sublist will be expanded or collapsed
APPEND TO LIST.Summary: The **APPEND TO LIST** command appends a new item to the hierarchical list whose list reference number you pass in *list*.

Application file.Summary: The Application file command returns the long name of the 4D executable file or application you are running.

Params: Information about the active application activity
Application info.Summary: The **Application info** command returns an object providing detailed information about the active application's activity and network configuration.

Params: Numeric value denoting the type of the application
Application type.Summary: The Application type command returns a numeric value that denotes the type of 4D environment that you are running.

Params: Long version number if passed, otherwise Short version number
Application version.Summary: The Application version command returns an encoded string value that expresses the version number of the 4D environment you are running.

One line of code or a method

Arctan.Summary: Arctan returns the angle, expressed in radians, of the tangent *number*.

Number of columns in a two-dimensional array

Number of columns in a two-dimensional array

Number of columns in a two-dimensional array

Field to receive the array data

ASSERT.Summary: The **ASSERT** command evaluates the *boolExpression* assertion passed in parameter and, if it returns false, stops the code execution with an error message.

Asserted.Summary: The **Asserted** command has an operation similar to that of the ASSERT command, with one difference in that it returns a value which is the result of the evaluation of the *boolExpression* parameter.

Path of attribute for which to return the average

BACKUP.Summary: The BACKUP command starts the backup of the database using the current backup settings.

BASE64 DECODE.Summary: The **BASE64 DECODE** command decodes the text or blob value coded in Base64 or Base64URL format passed in the *toDecode* parameter.

BASE64 ENCODE.Summary: The **BASE64 ENCODE** command encodes the text or blob value passed in the *toEncode* parameter in Base64 or Base64URL format.

BEEP.Summary: The BEEP command causes the PC or Macintosh to generate a beep.

Params: Table for which to test if record pointer is before the first selected record, or Default table, if omitted
Before selection.Summary: **Before selection** returns TRUE when the current record pointer is before the first record of the current selection of *table*.

Params: Returns True if the execution cycle is a before
Before.Summary: **Before** returns True for the Before execution cycle.

Begin SQL.Summary: Begin SQL is a keyword used in the Method editor to indicate the beginning of a sequence of SQL commands that must be interpreted by the current data source of the process (the integrated SQL engine of 4D or any source specified via the SQL LOGIN command).

Params: BLOB for which to get information
0 = BLOB is not compressed, 1 = Compact compression, 2 = Fast compression, -1 = GZIP Best compression, -2 = GZIP Fast compression
Size of BLOB (in bytes) when not compressed
BLOB PROPERTIES.Summary: The **BLOB PROPERTIES** command returns information about the BLOB *blob*.

Params: Size in bytes of the BLOB
BLOB size.Summary: BLOB sizereturns the size of *blob* expressed in bytes.

BLOB TO DOCUMENT.Summary: BLOB TO DOCUMENT rewrites the whole contents of *document* using the data stored in *blob*.

Params: BLOB from which to get the integer value
0 Native byte ordering 1 Macintosh byte ordering 2 PC byte ordering
Offset within the BLOB (expressed in bytes)
BLOB to integer.Summary: The BLOB to integer command returns a 2-byte Integer value read from the BLOB *blob*.

Params: Offset within the BLOB (expressed in bytes)
BLOB to list.Summary: The BLOB to list command creates a new hierarchical list with the data stored within the BLOB *blob* at the byte offset (starting at zero) specified by *offset* and returns a List Reference number for that new list.

Params: BLOB from which to get the Long Integer value
0 = Native byte ordering, 1 = Macintosh byte ordering, 2 = PC byte ordering
Offset within the BLOB (expressed in bytes)
BLOB to longint.Summary: The BLOB to longint command returns a 4-byte Long Integer value read from the BLOB *blob*.

BLOB TO PICTURE.Summary: The **BLOB TO PICTURE** command inserts a picture stored in a BLOB into a 4D picture variable or field, regardless its original format.

Params: 0=Restore saved values for number of copies and page range, 1=Reset to default values
Status code: 1=Operation successful, 0=No current printer, -1=Incorrect parameters, 2=Printer changed
BLOB to print settings.Summary: The **BLOB to print settings** command replaces the current 4D print settings with the parameters stored in the *printSettings* BLOB.

Params: BLOB from which to get the Real value
0=Native real format, 1=Extended real format, 2=Macintosh Double real format, 3=Windows Double real format
Offset within the BLOB (expressed in bytes)
BLOB to real.Summary: The BLOB to real command returns a Real value read from the BLOB *blob*.

Params: BLOB from which to get the text
Format and character set of text
Offset within the BLOB (expressed in bytes)
Number of characters to be read
BLOB to text.Summary: The BLOB to text command returns a Text value read from the BLOB *blob*.

Params: BLOB (encrypted) containing database user accounts created and saved by the database Administrator
BLOB TO USERS.Summary: The BLOB TO USERS command replaces the user accounts and groups found in the BLOB *users* in the current database.

Params: Variable to write with BLOB contents
Position of following variable within BLOB
BLOB TO VARIABLE.Summary: The BLOB TO VARIABLE command rewrites the variable *variable* with the data stored within the BLOB *blob* at the byte offset (starting at zero) specified by *offset*.

Params: Expression for which to return the boolean form
Bool.Summary: The **Bool** command returns the boolean form of the expression you passed in *expression*.

Params: Array to indicate if a record is in the set or not
Name of the set or UserSet if this parameter is omitted
BOOLEAN ARRAY FROM SET.Summary: The BOOLEAN ARRAY FROM SET command fills an array of Booleans indicating if each record in the table is or is not in *set*.

Params: Break level for which to do a page break
BREAK LEVEL.Summary: **BREAK LEVEL** specifies the number of break levels in a report performed using PRINT SELECTION.

Params: Process number of the process to pass to the frontmost level
BRING TO FRONT.Summary: **BRING TO FRONT** brings all the windows belonging to *process* to the front.

Params: Full access path of the settings file to use
BUILD APPLICATION.Summary: The BUILD APPLICATION command launches the application generation process.

Params: Defines list of attributes to be returned (filtered per DB)
Cache info.Summary: The **Cache info** command returns an object that contains detailed information about the current cache contents (used memory, loaded tables and indexes, etc.)

Params: Formula object or Name of project method
CALL FORM.Summary: The **CALL FORM** command executes the 4D code designated in *formula* with the optional *param*(s) in the context of a form displayed in a *window*, regardless of the process owning the window.

CALL SUBFORM CONTAINER.Summary: The CALL SUBFORM CONTAINER command lets a subform instance send the *event* to the subform object that contains it.

Params: Name or number of worker process
Formula object or Name of project method
CALL WORKER.Summary: The **CALL WORKER** command creates or calls the worker process whose name or ID you passed in *process*, and requests the execution of the code designated by *formula* in its context with the optional *param* parameter(s).

CANCEL TRANSACTION.Summary: **CANCEL TRANSACTION** cancels the transaction that was started with START TRANSACTION of the corresponding level in the current process.

CANCEL.Summary: In the context of data entry, **CANCEL** performs the same action as if the user had pressed the cancel key (**Esc**).

Params: State of the Caps Lock key
Caps lock down.Summary: Caps lock down returns TRUE if the Caps Lock key is pressed.

CHANGE CURRENT USER.Summary: **CHANGE CURRENT USER** changes the identity of the current user in the database, without needing to quit.

CHANGE LICENSES.Summary: The CHANGE LICENSES command displays the 4D License Manager dialog box.

CHANGE PASSWORD.Summary: CHANGE PASSWORD changes the password of the current user.

Change string.Summary: Change string changes a group of characters in *source* and returns the resulting string.

Char.Summary: The **Char** command returns the character whose code is *charCode*.

Params: Character for which you want to get the code
Character code.Summary: The **Character code** command returns the Unicode UTF-16 code (included between 1 and 65535) of *character*.

CHECK LOG FILE.Summary: The **CHECK LOG FILE** command displays the dialog box for viewing the current log file of the database (which can also be accessed via the Maintenance Security Center window)

Choose.Summary: The **Choose** command returns one of the values passed in the *value1*, *value2*, etc.

Params: If specified, clear sublists from memory, if any. If omitted, sublists (if any) are not cleared.
CLEAR LIST.Summary: The **CLEAR LIST** command deletes the hierarchical list whose list reference number you pass in *list*.

Params: Name of named selection to be cleared
CLEAR NAMED SELECTION.Summary: **CLEAR NAMED SELECTION** clears *name* from memory and frees the memory used by *name*.

CLEAR PASTEBOARD.Summary: The CLEAR PASTEBOARD command clears the pasteboard of all its contents.

CLEAR SEMAPHORE.Summary: **CLEAR SEMAPHORE** erases *semaphore* previously set by the Semaphore function.

Params: Name of the set to clear from memory
CLEAR SET.Summary: **CLEAR SET** clears *set* from memory and frees the memory used by *set*.

CLEAR VARIABLE.Summary: CLEAR VARIABLE resets *variable* to its default type value (*i.e.*, empty string for Text variables, *0* for numeric variables, no elements for arrays, etc.).

Clickcount.Summary: The **Clickcount** command returns, in the context of a mouse click event, the number of times the user has clicked in rapid succession with the same mouse button.

CLOSE DOCUMENT.Summary: **CLOSE DOCUMENT** closes the document specified by *docRef*.

CLOSE PRINTING JOB.Summary: The **CLOSE PRINTING JOB** command closes the print job previously opened by the OPEN PRINTING JOB command and sends any printing document that has been assembled to the current printer.

CLOSE RESOURCE FILE.Summary: The **CLOSE RESOURCE FILE** command closes the resource file whose reference number is passed in *resFile*.

Params: Window reference number, or Frontmost window of current process, if omitted
CLOSE WINDOW.Summary: **CLOSE WINDOW** closes the active window opened by the Open window or Open form window command in the current process.

Params: Array to receive the elements of the collection; if propertyName passed, array to receive the values of propertyName in the collection
Object property name whose values to copy in array ("" for all elements)
COLLECTION TO ARRAY.Summary: The **COLLECTION TO ARRAY** command fills one or more *array*(s) with elements or *propertyName* values from the *collection* into the *array*(s).

Params: Type of combination to be done
COMBINE PICTURES.Summary: The **COMBINE PICTURES** command combines the *pict1* and *pict2* pictures in *operator* mode in order to produce a third, *resultingPict*.

Params: Pathname of data file to be compacted
Pathname of folder where original data file will be put
Complete pathname of folder containing original data file
Compact data file.Summary: The **Compact data file** command compacts the data file designated by the *dataPath* parameter associated with the *structurePath* structure file.

Compare strings.Summary: The **Compare strings** command returns a negative, zero, or positive value depending on if *aString* is evaluated as lower, equal, or higher than *bString*.

COMPONENT LIST.Summary: The COMPONENT LIST command sizes and fills the *componentsArray* array with the names of the components loaded by the 4D application for the current host database.

Params: If not omitted: 1, compress as compact as possible 2, compress as fast as possible
COMPRESS BLOB.Summary: The **COMPRESS BLOB** command compresses the BLOB *blob* using a compression algorithm.

Params: Message to display in the confirmation dialog box
CONFIRM.Summary: The CONFIRM command displays a confirm dialog box composed of a note icon, a message, an OK button, and a Cancel Button.

Params: True if a contextual click was detected, otherwise False
Contextual click.Summary: The Contextual click command returns True if a contextual click has been made

CONVERT COORDINATES.Summary: The **CONVERT COORDINATES** command converts the (x;y) coordinates of a point from one coordinate system to another.

Params: Text expressed in current character set of 4D
Name or Number of character set
CONVERT FROM TEXT.Summary: The CONVERT FROM TEXT command can be used to convert a text expressed in the current character set of 4D to a text expressed in another character set.

Convert path POSIX to system.Summary: The **Convert path POSIX to system** command converts a pathname expressed with the POSIX (Unix) syntax into a pathname expressed with the system syntax.

Params: Relative or absolute pathname expressed in system syntax
Absolute pathname expressed in POSIX syntax
Convert path system to POSIX.Summary: The Convert path system to POSIX command converts a pathname expressed with the system syntax as a pathname expressed with the POSIX (Unix) syntax.

CONVERT PICTURE.Summary: The **CONVERT PICTURE** command converts *picture* into a new type.

Params: BLOB containing text expressed in a specific character set
Name or Number of BLOB character set
Contents of BLOB expressed in 4D character set
Convert to text.Summary: The **Convert to text** command converts the text contained in the *blob* parameter and returns it in text expressed in the character set of 4D.

COPY ARRAY.Summary: The COPY ARRAY command creates or overwrites the destination array *destination* with the exact contents, size, and type of the source array *source*.

Params: Number of bytes to be copied
COPY BLOB.Summary: The COPY BLOB command copies the number of bytes specified by *len* from the BLOB *srcBLOB* to the BLOB *dstBLOB*.

Params: Pathname of file or folder to be copied
Name or pathname of copied file or folder
New name of copied file or folder
COPY DOCUMENT.Summary: The **COPY DOCUMENT** command copies the file or folder specified by *sourceName* to the location specified by *destinationName* and, optionally, renames it.

Params: Reference to list to be copied
List reference number to duplicated list
Copy list.Summary: The **Copy list** command duplicates the list whose reference number you pass in *list,* and returns the list reference number of the new list.

Params: Table from which to copy selection, or Default table, if omitted
Name of the named selection to create
COPY NAMED SELECTION.Summary: **COPY NAMED SELECTION** copies the current selection of *aTable* to the named selection *name*.

Params: New collection containing parameters actually passed
Copy parameters.Summary: The Copy parameters command returns a new collection containing all parameters actually passed to a method or a function.

COPY SET.Summary: The COPY SET command copies the contents of the set *srcSet* into the set *dstSet*.

Params: Number, in radians, whose cosine is returned
Cos.Summary: Cos returns the cosine of *number*, where *number* is expressed in radians.

Count in array.Summary: The Count in array command returns the number of times *value* is found in *array*.

Params: If specified, list is an object name (string) If omitted, list is a list reference number
List reference number (if * omitted), or Name of list type object (if * passed)
If omitted (default): Return visible list items (expanded) If specified: Return all list items
Number of visible (expanded) list items (if 2nd * omitted) or Total number of list items (if 2nd * present)
Count list items.Summary: The Count list items command returns either the number of items currently visible or the total number of items in the list whose reference number or object name you pass in *list*.

Params: Number of menu items in the menu
Count menu items.Summary: The **Count menu items** command returns the number of menu items present in the menu whose number or reference is passed in *menu.

Params: Number of menus in the current menu bar
Count menus.Summary: The **Count menus** command returns the number of menus present in the menu bar.

**SET LIST ITEM PROPERTIES** ( {* ;} *list* ; *itemRef* ; *enterable* ; *styles* {; *icon* {; *color*}} )
**SET LIST ITEM PROPERTIES** ( * ; *list* ; * ; *enterable* ; *styles* {; *icon* {; *color*}} )
Params: If specified, list is an object name (string) If omitted, list is a list reference number
List reference number (if * omitted) or Name of list type object (if * passed)
Item reference number, or 0 for last item appended to the list, or * for the current list item
Picture name or number ("" or 0 for no icon)
RGB color value or -1 = reset to original color
SET LIST ITEM PROPERTIES.Summary: The **SET LIST ITEM PROPERTIES** command modifies the item designated by the *itemRef* parameter within the list whose reference number or object name is passed in *list*.

Params: If specified, list is an object name (string) If omitted, list is a list reference number
List reference number (if * omitted), or Name of list type object (if * passed)
Item reference number, or 0 for last item appended to the list, or * for the current item in the list
New sublist attached to item, or 0 for no sublist (detaching current one, if any), or -1 for no change
Indicates if the optional sublist will be expanded or collapsed
SET LIST ITEM.Summary: The **SET LIST ITEM** command modifies the item designated by the *itemRef* parameter within the list whose reference number or object name is passed in *list*.

Params: Minimal line height expressed in pixels
Expand/Collapse sublist on double-click 0 = Yes, 1= No
0 = List is not editable by user, 1 = List is editable by user (default)
SET LIST PROPERTIES.Summary: The **SET LIST PROPERTIES** command sets the line height and selection properties of the hierarchical list whose list reference you pass in *list*.

SET MACRO PARAMETER.Summary: The **SET MACRO PARAMETER** command inserts the *paramText* text into the method from which it has been called.

Params: Number or name of the menu bar or Menu reference
SET MENU BAR.Summary: **SET MENU BAR** replaces the current menu bar with the one specified by *menuBar* for the current process only.

Params: Number of menu item or -1 for the last item added to the menu
Name or number of picture to be associated with menu item
SET MENU ITEM ICON.Summary: The **SET MENU ITEM ICON** command modifies the icon associated with the menu item designated by the *menu* and *menuItem* parameters.

Params: Item number or -1 for last item added
SET MENU ITEM MARK.Summary: The **SET MENU ITEM MARK** command changes the check mark of the menu item whose menu number or reference is passed in *menu* and whose item number is passed in *menuItem* to the first character of the string passed in *mark*.

Params: Number of menu item or -1 for the last item added to the menu
SET MENU ITEM METHOD.Summary: The **SET MENU ITEM METHOD** command modifies the 4D project method associated with the menu item designated by the *menu* and *menuItem* parameters.

Params: Number of menu item or -1 for the last item added to the menu
SET MENU ITEM PARAMETER.Summary: The **SET MENU ITEM PARAMETER** command associates a custom character string with a menu item designated by the *menu* and *menuItem* parameters.

Params: Number of menu item or -1 for the last item added to the menu
SET MENU ITEM PROPERTY.Summary: The **SET MENU ITEM PROPERTY** command sets the *value* of the *property* for the menu item designated by the *menu* and *menuItem* parameters.

Params: Menu item number or -1 for last item added
Letter of keyboard shortcut or Character code of keyboard shortcut (former syntax)
Modifier(s) to associate with shortcut  (ignored if Character code is passed in itemKey)
SET MENU ITEM SHORTCUT.Summary: The **SET MENU ITEM SHORTCUT** command assigns a new shortcut to a menu item.

Params: Menu item number or -1 for last item added
SET MENU ITEM STYLE.Summary: The **SET MENU ITEM STYLE** command changes the font style of the menu item whose menu number or reference is passed in *menu* and whose item number is passed in *menuItem* according to the font style passed in *itemStyle*.

Params: Menu item number or -1 for the last item added
New text for the menu item
If passed: consider metacharacters as standard characters
SET MENU ITEM.Summary: The SET MENU ITEM command changes the text of the menu item whose menu number or reference is passed in *menu* and whose item number is passed in *menuItem*, to the text passed in *itemText*.

Params: Picture for which to set the default name
SET PICTURE FILE NAME.Summary: The **SET PICTURE FILE NAME** command sets or changes the default file name for the picture passed as parameter.

Params: Picture whose metadata you want to set
Name or path of block to set
SET PICTURE METADATA.Summary: The SET PICTURE METADATA command lets you set or modify the contents of the metadata (or meta-tags) found in the *picture* (4D picture field or variable), when they are modifiable.

Params: Reference number of Picture Library graphic
SET PICTURE TO LIBRARY.Summary: The **SET PICTURE TO LIBRARY** command creates a new picture or replaces a picture in the Picture Library.

Params: Picture to be placed in pasteboard
SET PICTURE TO PASTEBOARD.Summary: SET PICTURE TO PASTEBOARD clears the pasteboard and puts a copy of the picture passed in *picture* into it.

Params: Group name to associate with plug-in
SET PLUGIN ACCESS.Summary: The SET PLUGIN ACCESS command sets, by programming, the user group allowed to use each serialized plug-in that is installed in the database.

Params: If passed = move subsequent markers If omitted = do not move subsequent markers
SET PRINT MARKER.Summary: The **SET PRINT MARKER** command enables the definition of the marker position during printing.

SET PRINT OPTION.Summary: The **SET PRINT OPTION** command is used to modify, by programming, the value of a print option.

Params: Preview on screen (TRUE), or No preview (FALSE)
SET PRINT PREVIEW.Summary: **SET PRINT PREVIEW** allows you to programmatically check or uncheck the Preview on Screen option of the Print dialog box.

SET PRINTABLE MARGIN.Summary: The **SET PRINTABLE MARGIN** command sets the values of various printing margins by using the Print form, PRINT SELECTION and PRINT RECORD commands.

SET PROCESS VARIABLE.Summary: The **SET PROCESS VARIABLE** command writes the *dstVar* process variables (*dstVar2*, etc.) of the destination process whose number is passed in *process* using the values passed in *expr1* (*expr2*, etc.).

Params: True = Lock the records found by queries False = Do not lock records
SET QUERY AND LOCK.Summary: The **SET QUERY AND LOCK** command can be used to request the automatic locking of records found by all queries that follow the calling of this command in the current transaction.

Params: 0 = current selection, 1 = set, 2 = named selection, 3 = variable
Name of the set, or Name of the named selection, or Variable
Pointer to local variable if destinationType=3
SET QUERY DESTINATION.Summary: **SET QUERY DESTINATION** enables you to tell 4D where to put the result of any subsequent query for the current process.

Params: Number of records, or 0 for no limit
SET QUERY LIMIT.Summary: **SET QUERY LIMIT** allows you to tell 4D to stop any subsequent query for the current process as soon as at least the number of records you pass in *limit* has been found.

Params: Epsilon value for real equality comparisons
SET REAL COMPARISON LEVEL.Summary: The **SET REAL COMPARISON LEVEL** command sets the epsilon value used by 4D to compare real values and expressions for equality.

SET RECENT FONTS.Summary: The **SET RECENT FONTS** command modifies the list of fonts displayed in the context menu of the "recent fonts".

Params: Table whose scalar data priority value has to be set for the session
Cache priority value for scalar values in the table
SET TABLE CACHE PRIORITY.Summary: This command is reserved for specific needs.

Params: Table names as they must appear in dialog boxes
Use the custom names in the formula editor
SET TABLE TITLES.Summary: **SET TABLE TITLES** lets you mask, rename, and reorder the tables of your database that appear in standard 4D dialog boxes within the Application environment (i.e. when the startup mode is **Application**, or after you select **Test application** in the **Run** menu).

Params: Text to be put into the pasteboard
SET TEXT TO PASTEBOARD.Summary: **SET TEXT TO PASTEBOARD** clears the pasteboard and then puts a copy of the text you passed in *text* into the pasteboard.

SET TIMEOUT.Summary: **SET TIMEOUT** specifies how much time a serial port command has to complete.

Params: Tickcount or -1=Trigger as soon as possible
SET TIMER.Summary: The **SET TIMER** command activates the On Timer form event and sets, for the current form and process, the number of ticks elapsed between each On Timer form event.

Params: Pathname of folder (package under macOS) containing updated application

False (default) = report errors visibly,
True = do not report them
SET UPDATE FOLDER.Summary: The **SET UPDATE FOLDER** command specifies the folder containing the update of the current merged 4D application.

Params: Alternate user name for 4D user account or "" to reset
SET USER ALIAS.Summary: The **SET USER ALIAS** command defines an alternate, custom name to use in place of the current 4D user account name for the current session.

Params: Unique ID number of user account, -1 for adding a user
Unique ID number of added user account (if any)
Name of new user startup method
New (unencrypted) password, or * to leave the password unchanged
New number of logins to the database (Binary databases only)
New date of last login to the database (Binary databases only)
ID numbers of groups to which the user belongs
Reference number of user group owner (Binary databases only)
Unique ID number of new user
Set user properties.Summary: Set user properties lets you change and update the properties of an existing user account whose unique user ID number you pass in *userID*, or add a new user.

Params: Global left coordinate of window's contents area
Global top coordinate of window's contents area
Global right coordinate of window's contents area
Global bottom coordinate of window's contents area
Window reference number, or Frontmost window of current process, if omitted

If omitted (default) = change window to foreground
If passed = do not change the level of the window
SET WINDOW RECT.Summary: The SET WINDOW RECT command changes the global coordinates of the window whose reference number is passed in *window*.

Params: Window reference number, or Frontmost window of current process, if omitted
SET WINDOW TITLE.Summary: The **SET WINDOW TITLE** command changes the title of the window whose reference number is passed in *window* to the text passed in *title* (max. length 80 characters).

Shift down.Summary: Shift down returns TRUE if the Shift key is pressed.

SHOW MENU BAR.Summary: The SHOW MENU BAR command makes the menu bar visible.

Params: If the item is a folder, show its contents
SHOW ON DISK.Summary: The SHOW ON DISK command displays the file or folder whose pathname was passed in the *pathname* parameter in a standard window of the operating system.

Params: Process number of process to be shown
SHOW PROCESS.Summary: **SHOW PROCESS** displays all the windows belonging to *process*.

SHOW TOOL BAR.Summary: The **SHOW TOOL BAR** command handles the display of custom toolbars created by the Open form window command for the current process.

Params: Window reference number or Current process frontmost window, if omitted
SHOW WINDOW.Summary: The **SHOW WINDOW** command displays the window whose number was passed in *window*.

Params: Number, in radians, whose sine is returned
Sin.Summary: **Sin** returns the sine of *number*, where *number* is expressed in radians.

Params: Returns the number of elements in array
Size of array.Summary: The Size of array command returns the number of elements in *array*.

Params: Variable referring to an incoming or outgoing SOAP argument
4D type to which the argument points
Name published for this argument during SOAP exchanges
SOAP DECLARATION.Summary: The SOAP DECLARATION command explicitly declares the type of parameters used in a 4D method published as a Web Service.

Params: Number of type of SOAP info to get
SOAP Get info.Summary: The **SOAP Get info** command retrieves, in the form of a character string, the different types of information concerning a SOAP request.

Params: True if new requests are rejected, else false
SOAP REJECT NEW REQUESTS.Summary: The **SOAP REJECT NEW REQUESTS** command specifies whether or not the Web Services server accepts new SOAP requests.

Params: True if the request is SOAP; otherwise, False
SOAP Request.Summary: The **SOAP Request** command returns **True** if the code being executed is part of a SOAP request.

Params: Description of error to be sent to SOAP client
SOAP SEND FAULT.Summary: The **SOAP SEND FAULT** command returns an error to a SOAP client indicating the origin of the fault: client or server.

Params: ">" to sort in Ascending order, or "<" to sort in Descending order, or Ascending order if omitted
SORT ARRAY.Summary: The SORT ARRAY command sorts one or more arrays into ascending or descending order.

Params: Sorting order: > to sort in ascending order, or < to sort in descending order
SORT LIST.Summary: The **SORT LIST** command sorts the list whose reference number is passed in *list*.

Params: Word or list of words to add to user dictionary
SPELL ADD TO USER DICTIONARY.Summary: The **SPELL ADD TO USER DICTIONARY** command adds one or more words to the current user dictionary.

Params: Position of first character of unknown word
SPELL CHECK TEXT.Summary: The **SPELL CHECK TEXT** command checks the contents of the *text* parameter beginning from the *checkPos* character and returns the position of the first unknown word it finds (if any).

SPELL CHECKING.Summary: The **SPELL CHECKING** command triggers the spell check of the field or variable having the focus in the currently displayed form.

Params: ID of dictionary used for spell check
SPELL Get current dictionary.Summary: The **SPELL Get current dictionary** command returns the ID number of the dictionary being used.

SPELL GET DICTIONARY LIST.Summary: The **SPELL GET DICTIONARY LIST** command returns, in the *langID*, *langFiles* and *langNames* arrays, the IDs, file names and language names corresponding to the Hunspell dictionary files installed on the machine.

Params: ID, Name, or Language code of dictionary to use for spell-check
SPELL SET CURRENT DICTIONARY.Summary: The **SPELL SET CURRENT DICTIONARY** command causes the replacement of the current dictionary with the one specified by the *dictionary* parameter.

Params: String at which stringToSplit splits. If empty string (""), each character of stringToSplit is a substring
Option(s) regarding empty strings and spaces
Split string.Summary: The **Split string** command returns a collection of strings, created by splitting *stringToSplit* into substrings at the boundaries specified by the *separator* parameter.

SQL CANCEL LOAD.Summary: The **SQL CANCEL LOAD** command ends the current SELECT request and initializes the parameters.

SQL End selection.Summary: The SQL End selection command is used to determine if the boundaries of the result set have been reached.

Params: Complete pathname of file containing SQL script to execute
Action to carry out in case of error during script execution
SQL EXECUTE SCRIPT.Summary: The **SQL EXECUTE SCRIPT** command is used to execute a series of SQL statements placed in the script file designated by *scriptPath*.

SQL EXECUTE.Summary: The SQL EXECUTE command executes an SQL command and binds the result to 4D objects (arrays, variables or fields).

Params: Pathname of export folder or "" to display folder selection dialog box
Maximum number of files per folder
Size limit value of export files (in KB)
Size limit (in bytes) below which the contents of a Text, BLOB or Picture field is embedded into the main file
SQL EXPORT DATABASE.Summary: The SQL EXPORT DATABASE command exports in SQL format all the records of all the tables in the database.

Params: Table from which to export selection
Pathname of export folder or "" to display folder selection dialog box
Maximum number of files per folder
Maximum size of Export.sql file (in KB)
Size limit (in bytes) below which the contents of a Text, BLOB or Picture field are embedded into the main file
SQL EXPORT SELECTION.Summary: The **SQL EXPORT SELECTION** command exports in SQL format the records of the current selection of the 4D table designated by the *aTable* parameter.

Params: Name of current data source being used
SQL Get current data source.Summary: The SQL Get current data source command returns the name of the current data source of the application.

SQL GET DATA SOURCE LIST.Summary: The **SQL GET DATA SOURCE LIST** command returns, in the *sourceNamesArr* and *driversArr* arrays, the names and drivers of the *sourceType* type data sources defined in the ODBC manager of the operating system.

SQL GET LAST ERROR.Summary: The SQL GET LAST ERROR command returns information related to the last error encountered during the execution of an ODBC command.

SQL GET OPTION.Summary: The **SQL GET OPTION** command returns the current *value* of the option passed in *option*.

SQL LOAD RECORD.Summary: The SQL LOAD RECORD command retrieves one or more record(s) in 4D coming from the data source open in the current connection.

Params: Publication name of 4D database or IP address of remote database or Name of the data source entry in the ODBC Manager or "" to display the selection dialog box

Applied to Begin SQL/End SQL If omitted: do not apply (local database); if passed: apply

SQL LOGOUT.Summary: The SQL LOGOUT command closes the connection with an ODBC source that is open in the current process (if applicable).

SQL SET OPTION.Summary: The **SQL SET OPTION** command modifies the *value* of the option passed in *option*.

Params: 4D object to be used (variable, array or field)
SQL SET PARAMETER.Summary: The SQL SET PARAMETER command allows the use of a 4D variable, array or field value in SQL requests.

Square root.Summary: Square root returns the square root of *number*.

ST SET ATTRIBUTES.Summary: The ST SET ATTRIBUTES command can be used to modify one or more style attributes in the form object(s) designated by *object*.

If specified, object is an object name (string)

START MONITORING ACTIVITY.Summary: The **START MONITORING ACTIVITY** command records operations exceeding a specified *duration* in memory.

START SQL SERVER.Summary: The START SQL SERVER command launches the integrated SQL server in the 4D application where it has been executed.

START TRANSACTION.Summary: START TRANSACTION starts a transaction in the current process.

Params: Data for which to return the standard deviation
Std deviation.Summary: **Std deviation** returns the standard deviation of *series*.

STOP MONITORING ACTIVITY.Summary: The **STOP MONITORING ACTIVITY** command stops tracking activity started with the START MONITORING ACTIVITY command.

STOP SQL SERVER.Summary: The STOP SQL SERVER command stops the integrated SQL server in the 4D application where it has been executed.

Storage.Summary: The **Storage** method returns the catalog of shared objects or shared collections that you have registered in the *Storage* object on the current machine or component.

WP DELETE FOOTER.Summary: The **WP DELETE FOOTER** command deletes the footer element associated to the section or subsection defined by the *wpSection* parameter.

WP DELETE HEADER.Summary: The **WP DELETE HEADER** command deletes the header element associated to the section or subsection defined by the *wpSection* parameter.

WP DELETE PICTURE.Summary: The **WP DELETE PICTURE** command deletes the image defined by the *imgObj* parameter.

WP DELETE STYLE SHEET.Summary: The **WP DELETE STYLE SHEET** command removes the designated paragraph or character style sheet from the current document.

WP DELETE TEXT BOX.Summary: The **WP DELETE TEXT BOX** command deletes the text box defined by the *textBox* parameter.

WP Find all.Summary: The **WP Find all** command searches the *targetObj* for the *searchValue* based on the *searchCondition*.

Params: Range or element or 4D Write Pro document

WP Find next.Summary: The **WP Find next** command searches the *targetObj*, after the *searchAfter* range, for the *searchValue* based on the *searchCondition*.

Params: Range or element or 4D Write Pro document
Range before which to begin searching
WP Find previous.Summary: The **WP Find previous** command searches the *targetObj*, prior to the *searchBefore* range, for the *searchValue* based on the *searchCondition*.

Params: Range or element or 4D Write Pro document
WP FREEZE FORMULAS.Summary: The **WP FREEZE FORMULAS** command "freezes" the contents of the formulas in *targetObj*.

WP Get body.Summary: The **WP Get body** command returns the body element of the *wpDoc* 4D Write Pro document.

WP GET BOOKMARKS.Summary: The **WP GET BOOKMARKS** command returns an array containing the names of all bookmarks defined in *wpDoc*.

WP New footer.Summary: The **WP New footer** command creates and returns the footer associated to the section or subsection defined by the *wpSection* parameter.

WP New header.Summary: The **WP New header** command creates and returns the header associated to the section or subsection defined by the *wpSection* parameter.

accessKeyDefined.Summary: true if an access key is defined in the settings of the web server

certificateFolder.Summary: folder where the certificate files are located

characterSet.Summary: character set that the 4D Web Server should use to communicate with browsers connecting to the application

cipherSuite.Summary: cipher list used for the secure protocol

CORSEnabled.Summary: CORS (*Cross-origin resource sharing*) service status for the web server

CORSSettings.Summary: list of allowed hosts and methods for the CORS service

debugLog.Summary: status of the HTTP request log file

defaultHomepage.Summary: name of the default home page

HSTSMaxAge.Summary: maximum length of time (in seconds) that HSTS is active for each new client connection

HTTPCompressionLevel.Summary: compression level for all compressed HTTP exchanges for the 4D HTTP server (client requests or server replies)

HTTPCompressionThreshold.Summary: size threshold (bytes) for requests below which exchanges should not be compressed

HTTPPort.Summary: listening IP port number for HTTP

HTTPSPort.Summary: listening IP port number for HTTPS

inactiveProcessTimeout.Summary: life duration (in minutes) of the inactive legacy session processes

inactiveSessionTimeout.Summary: life duration (in minutes) of inactive legacy sessions (duration set in cookie)

IPAddressToListen.Summary: IP address on which the 4D Web Server will receive HTTP requests

keepSession.Summary: `True` if legacy sessions are enabled in the web server, `False` otherwise

maxConcurrentProcesses.Summary: maximum number of concurrent web processes supported by the web server

maxRequestSize.Summary: maximum size (in bytes) of incoming HTTP requests (POST) that the web server is allowed to process

maxSessions.Summary: maximum number of simultaneous legacy sessions

minTLSVersion.Summary: minimum TLS version accepted for connections

name.Summary: name of the web server application

openSSLVersion.Summary: version of the OpenSSL library used

rootFolder.Summary: path of web server root folder

scalableSession.Summary: `True` if scalable sessions are used in the web server, and `False` otherwise

sessionCookieName.Summary: name of the cookie used for storing the session ID

sessionIPAddressValidation.Summary: IP address validation for session cookies
